    • Method Detail

      • wasUpdated

        public boolean wasUpdated()
        Determine if an update occurred.

        The supplied Update indicates if a modification was made. If no modification was made, no store operation is performed and this will return false.

        Returns:
        true if the supplied Update modified the retrieved object, false otherwise.

      • hasValues

        public boolean hasValues()
        Determine if this response contains any returned values.
        Returns:
        true if values are present, false otherwise.

      • getNumberOfValues

        public int getNumberOfValues()
        Return the number of values contained in this response.

        If siblings are present at the Location, all values are returned.

        Returns:
        the number of values in this response.

      • getValues

        public List<RiakObject> getValues()
        Get all the objects returned in this response.

        If siblings were present in Riak for the object you were fetching, this method will return all of them to you.

        Returns:
        a list of values as RiakObjects

      • getVectorClock

        public VClock getVectorClock()
        Get the vector clock returned with this response.

        When storing/retrieving core Java types (HashMap, ArrayList,String, etc) or non-annotated POJOs this method allows you to retrieve the vector clock.

        Returns:
        The vector clock or null if one is not present.

      • getValues

        public <T> List<T> getValues(Class<T> clazz)
        Get all the objects returned in this response.

        If siblings were present in Riak for the object you were fetching, this method will return all of them to you.

        The values will be converted to the supplied class using the Converter returned from the ConverterFactory. By default this will be the JSONConverter, or no conversion at all if you pass in RiakObject.class.

        Parameters:
        clazz - the class to be converted to
        Returns:
        a list of values, converted to the supplied class.
        See Also:
        ConverterFactory, Converter

      • getValue

        public <T> T getValue(Class<T> clazz)
           throws UnresolvedConflictException
        Get a single, resolved object from this response.

        The values will be converted to the supplied class using the Converter returned from the ConverterFactory. By default this will be the JSONConverter, or no conversion at all if you pass in RiakObject.class. If there are multiple values present (siblings), they will then be resolved using the ConflictResolver returned by the ConflictResolverFactory.

        Parameters:
        clazz - the class to be converted to.
        Returns:
        the single, resolved value converted to the supplied class.
        Throws:
        UnresolvedConflictException
        See Also:
        ConverterFactory, Converter, ConflictResolverFactory, ConflictResolver

      • getValue

        public <T> T getValue(com.fasterxml.jackson.core.type.TypeReference<T> typeReference)
           throws UnresolvedConflictException
        Get a single, resolved object from this response.

        The values will be converted to the supplied class using the Converter returned from the ConverterFactory. By default this will be the JSONConverter, or no conversion at all if you pass in RiakObject.class. If there are multiple values present (siblings), they will then be resolved using the ConflictResolver returned by the ConflictResolverFactory.

        This version should only be used if you're converting to a parameterized generic domain object. For example: 

         TypeReference<MyPojo<String>> tr = new TypeReference<MyPojo<String>>(){};
 MyPojo<String> myPojo = response.getValue(tr);

        Parameters:
        typeReference - The TypeReference of the class to be converted to.
        Returns:
        the single, resolved value converted to the supplied class.
        Throws:
        UnresolvedConflictException
        See Also:
        ConverterFactory, Converter, ConflictResolverFactory, ConflictResolver

      • getValues

        public <T> List<T> getValues(com.fasterxml.jackson.core.type.TypeReference<T> typeReference)
        Get the objects returned in this response.

        If siblings were present in Riak for the object you were fetching, this method will return all of them to you.

        The values will be converted to the supplied class using the Converter returned from the ConverterFactory. By default this will be the JSONConverter, or no conversion at all if you pass in a TypeReference for RiakObject.class.

        This version should only be used if you're converting to a parameterized generic domain object. For example: 

         TypeReference<MyPojo<String>> tr = new TypeReference<MyPojo<String>>(){};
 List<MyPojo<String>> list = response.getValues(tr);

        Parameters:
        typeReference - the TypeReference for the class to be converted to
        Returns:
        a list of values, converted to the supplied class.
        See Also:
        ConverterFactory, Converter
